episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4001_1101_0:
A sweets festival had taken over the city
for the day.

A long line of eager customers queued up
in front of one of the festival’s best sellers,
the famous Casteliacone from Castelia City.
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4001_1001_0:
Just a little farther, [Name:PlayerNickname ]!
We’re almost to the front! It’s been ages
since I’ve had a Casteliacone. I’m so excited!

They really, really are!
Watch, one bite and you’ll be addicted!

Plus, they’re made to look like Vanillite,
so they’re really cute, too!

Oh, I already know what they look like!
I did some research before coming here today.

I want to know how they taste. What about
the texture? Are they more creamy or airy?
What do you like most about Casteliacones?

Wow, I didn’t realize you were that interested!
Why the sudden curiosity about Casteliacones?
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4001_1001_1:
I want to figure out why certain things become
popular. What is it about them that makes
so many people go crazy?

It’s important to be eager to learn, no matter
what the topic is. The same goes for applying
that knowledge to your Pokémon battles.

You really love learning, huh! As for Casteliacones,
I think tasting one for yourself will be a lot more
helpful than asking me to describe them.
Plus, it’ll be more fun that way! Am I right?

I...suppose that’s true. All right, then!
I’ll look forward to tasting one myself!

Hehe! Look, a gap in the line just for me!
Guess today’s my lucky day!

Excuse me! What do you think you’re doing?
Cutting in line is against the rules.

Who cares! What’s the big deal, anyways?
You can’t expect me to wait in line for hours
just for some dumb ice cream.
D-dumb ice cream? Dumb ice cream?!

Casteliacones are famous! They always sell out
immediately, even in Castelia City, where they’re
originally from!
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4001_1001_2:
Waiting in line for hours to get your hands on
one is part of what makes it so delicious!
You really don’t get it at all, do you?!

Sheesh! Somebody woke up on the wrong side of
bed this morning...

Regardless, I won’t tolerate rule-breaking!
Now march yourself right to the back of the line.
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4003_1001_0:
Ugh! Fine then!
I’ll go to the back of the dumb line. Happy?!

The two of you are quite strong, aren’t you...
I’m impressed!

Although...your battle style is a bit on the
reckless side.

What?! I wouldn’t call it reckless.
How will you know if something’s gonna work or
not if you don’t jump in there and give it a try?

Traveling around the Unova region taught me
to take the initiative.

If you stop and think for too long, sometimes
you end up missing your chance.

What I’m trying to say is that it’s good to take
action! You can always reflect on things later.

That’s how I intend to raise my Tepig—from now
until she evolves into a fiery Emboar!

Interesting... I guess I’ve never really thought
of it that way.
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4003_0401_1:
I thought you’d say that! I’ve always felt like
we were pretty similar in that regard!
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4003_0302_1: I prefer to think first, act later!
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4003_0402_1:
I knew you’d say that! Great minds think
alike, [Name:PlayerNickname ].
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4003_1001_1:
If you’re not busy at the moment, do you want to
have a Pokémon battle?

I was watching you battle earlier, and now I’m
itching to fight!

Oh, really? Well, maybe another battle will
help Hilda see sense when it comes to the
importance of good planning.

Or it’ll help Roxanne realize that taking action is
more important than planning everything out!
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4005_1001_0:
That was awesome, [Name:PlayerNickname ]!
Another win for us!

My thorough planning and calm, cool analysis
seem to have done the trick.

And I knocked down the competition with
brute strength!

When it comes to battle style, we really are
complete opposites, aren’t we...

But we managed to win despite that.
I don’t understand—
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4005_1101_0:
Attention all customers currently in line
for a Casteliacone!

Thank you for waiting, but we’ve just sold our
last cone for the day! We are now sold out!
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4005_1001_0: What?! H-how could they sell out so soon?!

But we’ve waited all this time!
I can’t believe we missed out.
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4005_1001_1:
Shoot! I was really looking forward to having
a Casteliacone today.
Um, can I help you with something?

I just thought I’d take this opportunity to perform
an analysis on your Pokémon. Your battle earlier
has me quite intrigued.

Huh?! Analysis?
You didn’t even ask us first!
Hey, look! He’s got four Casteliacones!

Oh, these? I bought them for an experiment.
I plan to feed them to Pokémon and observe
their responses.

Why, do you want them? I guess I could let
them go if you agree to battle me instead.
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4005_1001_2:
Collecting data from your Pokémon is worth
more to me than a few ice cream cones.

This will be fun. I look forward to analyzing
all of the data later.
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4007_1001_0:
Whoa! Whoa!
You’re even more impressive than I thought!
We did it! That was some excellent teamwork!

It’s like we were totally in sync!
We make such an awesome team!

The question is how, though, right?
Our battle styles are still polar opposites.

Hmm, this can’t be right... My data-interpreting
machine was just reading at 78% a moment ago.

Oh, don’t mind me! Just mumbling to myself...
You can just ignore that number.

It seems my data analysis was insufficient to
keep up with the movements and commands
of you three and your Pokémon.

A sub-optimal performance indeed...
I stand defeated.

Wait, are you saying we were so in sync that
we broke your machine? How awesome is that!
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4007_1001_1:
Our styles may be totally different, but when
we were battling together, it felt like something
just clicked.

I’d have to collect a lot more data to be sure.
I think there’s something else at work here...
something that can’t be expressed in numbers.

Ah, that reminds me. Four Casteliacones in
exchange for a battle, as promised.

Oh. Well, that’s unfortunate.
Though that is to be expected with ice cream.

I can’t believe this... After all that buildup,
I don’t even get to taste one?

Wait—pause! Melted or not, the ingredients
are all still there. Melting shouldn’t change
the flavor, right?!
episode_event_ch0004_00_toko/4007_1001_2:
I...guess so? Maybe?
Why don’t we just come back again tomorrow
and wait in line for a good, not-melted one?

We’ll have plenty of time to chat while we wait.
Maybe we can get to know each other a
little better!

That’s not a bad idea. Like you said before,
waiting in line is part of what makes
Casteliacones delicious, right?

I’m sure they’ll taste even more amazing
after spending all that time with you and
[Name:PlayerNickname ]!
